Description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development announced two settlement agreements with a New Mexico builder and a Florida title insurance company for violations of the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (RESPA). HUD alleged that Fidelity National Title Insurance Company and Longford Homes of New Mexico, Inc. were engaged in a business arrangement that violated RESPA's anti-kickback and referral fee provisions.

SunGard Business Systems agreed to pay the United States $425,000 to settle allegations that it violated the False Claims Act in connection with a subcontract to deliver an automated record-keeping system to the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board.

Agency: Washington State Department of Labor & Industries
Info Source: Contained in data obtained on May 15, 2017 in response to an open records request.

Private Litigation Case Title: Jonathan Bromberg v. Fidelity National Information Services, Inc. et al

Description: A group of title companies agreed to pay a total of $50 million to settle allegations that they engaged in deceptive advertising and unfair business practices in their escrow services.
failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee

Company: Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. et al.
Description: Chicago Title Insurance Co., Fidelity National Title Insurance Co., Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. of New York, Security Union Title Insurance Co. and Ticor Title Insurance Co. agreed to pay $5,425,000 in penalties, return overcharges on premiums up to $7,700,000 and pay $175,000 in costs in settlement of allegations their captive reinsurance agreements constituted unfair competition, deceptive practices, and unlawful rebates, along with allegations of filing false statements and operating aN unlicensed business.

Company: Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. et al.
Description: Chicago Title Insurance Co., Fidelity National Title Insurance Co., Fidelity National Title Co., Security Union Title Insurance Corp., Lawyers Title Insurance Corp., Fidelity National Home Warranty Co., and Ticor Title Insurance Co. agreed to pay $1,250,000 in penalties and $175,000 in costs in settlement of allegations they engaged in unlawful inducement activities.

Company: Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. et al.
Fidelity National Title Insurance Co. et al.
Info Source: Texas October Enforcement Actions Result in $1M in Fines, Restitution, Insurance Journal, December 3, 2010 (via Nexis).

Company: Fidelity National Title Insurance Company & Chicago Title Insurance Company
Description: Issuing title insurance direct to consumers without having a direct operation in the State of Utah.
Fine levied for promoting access to discounts, for non-title insurance related products, to producers of title insurance business their sales representative. RCW 48.29.210(2); RCW 48.05.185
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
